page.title: 17ANGLESEY ABBEY
page.content: Anglesey Abbey is located just off the B11O2 leading of into Cambridge.The Abbey's gardens are open from Easter to October the 31st.The gardens have great variety and scale.It has a magnificent herbaceous garden. The water mill was bought by Lord Fairhaven in 1934. Most of the machinery is intact and has been restored and so the mill can grind corn. It is open Saturdays but it is working on the first Sunday of each month.The priory belongs to the National Trust but is lived in by Lord Fairhaven.The house has luxurious furnishings and rare works of art.In the car park there is the visitors centre with the shop and the cafe.
